name: New York
hint: The Big Apple, America's most populous city with iconic skyscrapers

name: Los Angeles
hint: City of Angels, home to Hollywood and the entertainment industry

name: Chicago
hint: The Windy City on Lake Michigan, known for deep-dish pizza

name: Toronto
hint: Canada's largest city, home to the CN Tower on Lake Ontario

name: Mexico City
hint: Capital of Mexico, built on the ruins of the Aztec capital Tenochtitlan

name: Vancouver
hint: Coastal city in British Columbia, surrounded by mountains and ocean

name: Washington DC
hint: Capital of the United States, home to the White House and Capitol

name: Houston
hint: Largest city in Texas, home to NASA's Mission Control

name: Montreal
hint: Largest French-speaking city in North America, in Quebec

name: Havana
hint: Capital of Cuba, famous for classic cars and colonial architecture

name: San Francisco
hint: City by the Bay, known for the Golden Gate Bridge and cable cars

name: Miami
hint: Tropical city in southern Florida, gateway to Latin America

name: Seattle
hint: Pacific Northwest city known for the Space Needle, coffee culture, and tech industry

name: Boston
hint: Historic New England city, home to Harvard and MIT nearby

name: Atlanta
hint: Capital of Georgia, a major hub of the American South and civil rights history

name: Phoenix
hint: Capital of Arizona, one of the hottest cities in the United States

name: Guadalajara
hint: Mexico's second-largest city, birthplace of mariachi and tequila

name: Monterrey
hint: Industrial capital of northern Mexico, surrounded by dramatic mountains

name: Panama City
hint: Capital of Panama, located at the Pacific entrance of the famous canal

name: Santo Domingo
hint: Capital of the Dominican Republic, oldest continuously inhabited European settlement in the Americas

name: Calgary
hint: Alberta city famous for the Stampede rodeo, gateway to the Canadian Rockies

name: Ottawa
hint: Capital of Canada, located on the Ontario-Quebec border along the Ottawa River

name: Kingston
hint: Capital of Jamaica, birthplace of reggae music and Bob Marley's legacy

name: San Jose
hint: Capital of Costa Rica, situated in the fertile Central Valley highlands

name: Guatemala City
hint: Capital of Guatemala, largest city in Central America

name: Cancun
hint: Mexican resort city on the Caribbean coast of the Yucatan Peninsula

name: Portland
hint: Oregon's largest city known for its eco-friendly culture, food trucks, and craft beer

name: Nashville
hint: Capital of Tennessee, famous as Music City and the home of country music

name: Austin
hint: Capital of Texas, known for its live music scene and the slogan Keep It Weird

name: Denver
hint: The Mile High City, capital of Colorado at exactly one mile above sea level

name: Minneapolis
hint: City of Lakes in Minnesota, forms the Twin Cities with neighboring Saint Paul

name: Detroit
hint: Motor City in Michigan, birthplace of the American automobile industry and Motown music

name: Philadelphia
hint: City of Brotherly Love where the Declaration of Independence was signed

name: Las Vegas
hint: Entertainment capital of the world in the Nevada desert, famous for its Strip

name: New Orleans
hint: Louisiana city famous for jazz, Mardi Gras, and Cajun and Creole cuisine

name: Tegucigalpa
hint: Capital of Honduras, a mountain city at over 900 meters elevation

name: Managua
hint: Capital of Nicaragua, located on the southern shore of Lake Managua

name: San Salvador
hint: Capital of El Salvador, nestled in a valley surrounded by volcanoes

name: Belize City
hint: Largest city in Belize, a Caribbean port and gateway to the Barrier Reef

name: Port-au-Prince
hint: Capital of Haiti, a bustling port city on the Gulf of Gonave

name: Edmonton
hint: Capital of Alberta, Canada, gateway to the northern oil sands and wilderness

name: Winnipeg
hint: Capital of Manitoba, at the confluence of the Red and Assiniboine Rivers

name: Quebec City
hint: Historic walled city in Canada, capital of Quebec province with French heritage

name: Honolulu
hint: Capital of Hawaii, located on Oahu with famous Waikiki Beach

name: Anchorage
hint: Largest city in Alaska, nestled between mountains and Cook Inlet

name: Puebla
hint: Mexican city famous for its colonial architecture and Cinco de Mayo battle site

name: Merida
hint: Capital of Yucatan state in Mexico, gateway to Mayan ruins like Chichen Itza

name: Halifax
hint: Capital of Nova Scotia, a major Atlantic port with maritime heritage

name: San Juan
hint: Capital of Puerto Rico, one of the oldest European-founded cities in the Americas

name: Nassau
hint: Capital of the Bahamas, a colorful Caribbean port city on New Providence Island
